title: Cherokee leader Shoe Boots on children - situation

content.question: Which of the following statements best explains the fate of individuals such as Tuskingoâ€™s children during the forcible removal of the Cherokee west of the Mississippi during the Trail of Tears?

choices.label: They were removed along with the rest of the Cherokee while remaining enslaved.
They gained their freedom through volunteering to fight for the Union against the Confederacy.
They were declared free by the federal government because Indian Territory would be free of slavery.
They were emancipated by an amendment to the United States Constitution.

content.answer: They were removed along with the rest of the Cherokee while remaining enslaved.
